skillTree.localised_description: The finest Ellyrion steed, atop which Tyrion has single-handedly put verminous hordes to flight.
The High Elves possess a natural skill that far outstrips the prowess of ordinary mortals.
The Trickster God knows all manner of ploys and ruses that can be used to counter missile attacks.
Knowledge can be used as a shield against magical attack.
Ulthuan can and will be whole again; believe and it shall be true.
In those rare, fleeting times of peace, you must prepare for war.

effects.description: Global recruitment duration: -1 turn for all units

skillTree.localised_description: When your goals are worthy, decent, and entirely free of self-interest, those of a similar nature flock to your banner.
Eventually, the curse of Aenarion will reveal itself in those of his line; it is inevitable - it is in their very blood.
From time to time, even the virtuous are liable to be consumed by the violent passion of the Bloody-handed God.
As the curse emerges, facets of the Bloody-handed God reveal themselves.
We, the Asur – the sons of Aenarion and Ulthuan – shall never fall.
Asuryan's adherents believe they are part of the Creator's plan and will never be abandoned.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -5% for Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The supporters of Hoeth bask in their patron's generosity, for it was he who gifted the Elves with much of their revered knowledge.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Swordmasters of Hoeth units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -5% for Swordmasters of Hoeth units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The God of Smiths knows the Elves will need fire and fury to survive; his blessings steel them for the darker days ahead.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Dragon Princes units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -5% for Dragon Princes units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Isha's husband is the father of all Elves; his blessings are given to those who hunt for food, but woe betide those who kill for sport.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for White Lions of Chrace, War Lions and Lion Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -5% for White Lions of Chrace, War Lions and Lion Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Goddess of Fertility blesses farmers and mothers, but also those votaries who are caught abroad in dangerous lands.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Spearmen, Rangers and Archers units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -5% for Spearmen, Rangers and Archers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who follow the Bringer of Wrath and Fire are blessed with direct and forceful solutions to the obstacles in their way.
As the Lord of the Sea, Mathlann is patron to sailors and explorers; he is prayed to by Elves about to embark on a voyage or seeking new lands.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -5% for Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: If you can hold you ground when all around are falling into the cracks, then that's the patronage of Hukon, God of Earthquakes.
The sword is the axis of the world and its power is absolute.
Panic and fear are things that happen to others.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dark Elves
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Dark Elves, Warriors of Chaos, Norsca and Beastmen

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.
Personal glory and regimental achievement must be set aside in times of great peril.

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing that it is the rare plan that survives contact with the enemy, yet being prepared for all eventualities, raises this one above mere planners.

skillTree.localised_description: Being present at the very forefront of the assault, on many occasions, prepares one for future engagements of a similar nature.

skillTree.localised_description: When the gale always blows in the direction of your choosing, failure becomes a rare event indeed.

skillTree.localised_description: Speed, agility and control - all must be mastered if your crushing tide is to break perfectly upon enemy shores.

skillTree.localised_description: The very centre of the fire always burns the hottest.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
“Underlying most arguments against the free market is a lack of belief in freedom itself.”
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

effects.description:
Attrition: -3% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -8% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Far removed from the petty squabbles of other races, many High Elves are able to devote themselves to learning, magic and the arts.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Rally to my banner, and we shall bathe the plains with the blood of our enemies!"

effects.description:
Upkeep: -50% for Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Rangers, Archers and Silver Helms units
	(Lord's army)

Recruit rank: +3 for Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

items.colour_text: Forged in Vaul's Anvil, worn by Aenarion until his death, and only a few of Ulthuan's gloried heroes since.
